issue.title: Only show links to google/ChatGPT if the site is localhost

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

We introduced error links with Google/ChatGPT, but we have found that this does not work well in production scenarios for multiple reasons. We have decided to only show these links while the url is localhost (indicating development mode).

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)

closes #10924

## Testing Plan

- JS unit tests updated or added.

---

**Contribution License Agreement**

By submitting this pull request you agree that all contributions to this project are made under the Apache 2.0 license.

body: Hey @ChristophBoerlin, we decided for now to only show these links if the app is viewed on localhost and hide them otherwise, similar to how we e.g. do it for the "Clear cache" menu option and a few other things. Do you think that's sufficient for you or would you still need an actual config option?
Hello @ChristophBoerlin , we released Streamlit 1.44.1 which included a fix for this (only showing these links on localhost). Thanks again for reporting this issue!

issue.title: Add ability to remove link to Google and ChatGPT for Exception

labels.name: type:enhancement
labels.description: Requests for feature enhancements or new features

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
### Checklist

- [x] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar feature requests.
- [x] I added a descriptive title and summary to this issue.

### Summary

Upon upgrading streamlit v1.44.0, I noticed that the Exceptions now feature a link to ChatGPT. Is there a way to disable this?

### Why?

A link to ChatGPT can be detrimental for using streamlit. Certain users, organizations etc. might have policies against using ChatGPT.

### How?

Add possibility to disable the links in Exception

### Additional Context

_No response_

body: Hello, referring to the above message, I think a **config option** would be great in order to allow developers to remove those two links during Exceptions when exposing the app to end users (even in localhost). Would it be possible to integrate this feature?
@eli-zaa since we closed this issue, can you create a new one and ideally describe why you need a config option and the automatic behavior is not enough, so we can prioritize this accordingly?
